sub_title: (International) Project Manager / Project Leader/ Business Development/ Program Coordinator
summary:
20+ years of work experience, working for multinationals and leading companies (Logitech, Ecorys, Springer, Datri (telecom)).  Titles held to date include (International) Program Coordinator, (International) Project Manager, Project Leader, and more recently, Business Developer. 

Quick learner of various business sectors and processes.  Each role requires strong stakeholder management to ensure the desired outcome. Teamwork is essential in each of my roles which lead to the successful completion of projects, programs, and customer solutions.

Results-focused with strong communication and problem-solving skills and a hands-on approach. Positive with an opportunity mindset.

en stratégie à périmètre institutionnel respectivement pour le MINMAP et l’ARMP', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Esther', 'last_name': 'Verdries', 'name': None, 'headline': '(International) Project Manager / Project Leader/ Business Development/ Program Coordinator'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ecorys FWC', 'last_name': 'Unit', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Ecorys International Development Unit for Long and Short Term Projects in EU28 and Developing Countries'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Noor', 'last_name': 'Oudshoorn', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Head of People Experience EU&ASIA'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Pierre', 'last_name': 'Morin', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Expert in Procurement Reform Program Implementation'}]}, {'title': 'Lot 11 - PEFA based assessment of Greenland', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'EU Delegation Greenland (Denmark)
The global objective of the study is to perform a PEFA (public expenditure and financial accountability) based assessment of the quality, transparency, accountability, and effectiveness of public finance management (PFM) in Greenland. 

Specific objectives: 
In the short-term, a PEFA assessment may be used as baseline data, and as a basis for information and monitoring so as to: (i) facilitate and update the dialogue on PFM between Government of Greenland and the donors; (ii) help donors assess eligibility for budget support programmes; (iii) recommend specific elements in the PFM for improvement and the medium term target to achieve; (iv) recommend the intermediary annual targets for these specific elements in order to achieve these specific improvements.

In the medium-term, the PEFA assessment may contribute to reflections on: (i) the preparation or revision of a PFM reform strategy (and related action plan); (ii) the preparation or revision of a PFM capacity development programme, in coordination with the Government of Greenland.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Esther', 'last_name': 'Verdries', 'name': None, 'headline': '(International) Project Manager / Project Leader/ Business Development/ Program Coordinator'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ecorys FWC', 'last_name': 'Unit', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Ecorys International Development Unit for Long and Short Term Projects in EU28 and Developing Countries'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Danitsja', 'last_name': 'van Heusden -
